text: conn-young
he may look like an overgrown child's
toy but kirobo is no plaything this is
video from earlier this month of his
first conversation in space with
Japanese astronaut Koichi Wakata the
current commander of the International
Space Station I've been looking forward
to seeing you says commander Waikato
I've been wanting to see you for a long
time to kirobo responds the point is
this conversation is unscripted key
robos electronic brain is designed to
respond in a natural human-like way and
to learn as he goes along
back on earth his designer thinks there
is a big future for robots like him
whereas others regard robots as working
machines he says Japanese people believe
in a future where robots and humans
coexist
so we aim to bring into people's view a
world where robots and humans live in
harmony they're sort of the power back
in space jirobo is getting into the
Christmas spirit do you have anything to
ask Santa for Christmas commander Wakata
asks him a toy rocket kirobo responds
where the Carrabba is really an
important scientific experiment or an
elaborate publicity stunt many here in
Japan think robots like him will be our
future companions
